summary: Henry B. Gonzalez is mentioned in the context of payroll records for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is identified as an authorizing official on payroll authorization forms for HSCA staff members. His signature appears on documents related to staff appointments, salary adjustments, and title changes within the committee. The documents span from 1976 to 1979, indicating his involvement during the operational period of the HSCA. The pattern across the documents suggests his role was primarily administrative, involving the authorization of personnel actions within the HSCA.
significance: Henry B. Gonzalez's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as an authorizing official for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His signature on payroll documents indicates his involvement in the administrative aspects of the committee's operations. While the documents do not reveal any direct involvement in the investigation itself, his authorization of personnel actions suggests he held a position of authority within the HSCA.
